title.narrative: NP Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Improvement Project

description.narrative: The development objectives of the project are to: (i) Increase sustainable access to improved water services and promote improved sanitation and hygiene practices in rural areas; and (ii) Develop and implement a long-term support mechanism to promote the sustainability of water supply schemes in selected districts.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Water Supply and Sanitation
Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Fund Development Board

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement: Additional Condition of Effectiveness | Description: The Subsidiary Agreement has been executed by the Recipientand the Project Implementing Entity. | Due Date: 14-Nov-2014

Finance Agreement: Implementation | Description: The Recipient and the Project Implementing Entity shall carry of their RespectiveParts of the Project in accordance with the Project Operations Manual and the GAAP. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Institutional Arrangements | Description: For purposes of Component/Part 2, the Recipient shall establish andmaintain in each Participating District a District WASH Unit. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Institutional Arrangements | Description: The Recipient shall maintain the Project Management Unit with anadequate number of professional staff satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Safeguards | Description: The Recipient shall and shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to carry out theProject in accordance with the Safeguards Instruments. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Sanitation Sub-grants under Part 1(c) | Description: The Project Implementing Entity shall make SanitationSub-grants available to VDC with eligibility criteria and processes acceptable to the Association. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Schemes under Part 1(b) | Description: The Project Implementing Entity shall ensure that from Batch XI onwardSchemes are part of the respective district's approved annual program. | Frequency: CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement: Schemes under Part 1(b) | Description: The Project Implementing Entity shall select Schemes and SupportOrganizations in accordance with eligible criteria satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Number of VDCs declared ODF by the Districts.
People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices - female
Improved public latrines constructed under the project (number) in schools and health posts.
People trained on improved hygiene behavior, and sanitation practices - Students
People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices under the proj
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Number of water supply schemes completed and in operation; of which (Jagaran Committee established).
Number of WSUCs formed; (those with at least 3 women members).
Number of schemes visited by the backstopping facility at the District level; of which (percentage of schemes non-functioning).
People provided with improved water supply through rehabilitation of schemes in earthquake affects districts
Number of newly constructed schemes provided with post-construction support by the project.
Number of community, municipal, private sector WASH stakeholders trained by the project
Number of households (HHs) to achieve total sanitation. Target 150,000 HH.
Number of household yard connections (new or rehabilitated under the project)
Local Government Level M&E system established and 25% of detected functionality issues addressed
Municipal Water and Sanitation Units (MWASH Unit) formally established under the Local Government with defined functions
